intro: Physaria chambersii var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple-flowered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, showy purple flowers. The plant produces distinctive inflated seed pods that resemble bladders, a feature shared with other members of its genus. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
